get.description:
Depending on what values you provide for **comp** and **restype** query params, response is returned as following:
* **comp==properties** and **restype==service**: gets the properties of a storage account’s Table service, including properties for [Storage Analytics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh343270.aspx) and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.
* **comp==stats** and **restype==service**: retrieves statistics related to replication for the Table service. It is only available on the secondary location endpoint when read-access geo-redundant replication is enabled for the storage account.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see [Setting Timeouts for Queue Service Operations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179396.aspx).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature. For more information, see [Authentication for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179428.aspx).

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request. For more information, see [Authentication for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179428.aspx). Mutually exclusive with **x-ms-date** but one or another is required.

parameters.name: x-ms-date
parameters.description: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request. For more information, see [Authentication for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179428.aspx). Mutually exclusive with **Date** but one or another is required.

parameters.name: x-ms-version
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request. For more information, see [Versioning for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx).

parameters.name: x-client-requiest-id
parameters.description: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled. Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server. For more information, see [About Storage Analytics Logging](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh343262.aspx) and [Azure Logging Using Logs to Track Storage Requests](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx).

x-ms-request-id.description: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the service.

x-ms-version.description: Specifies the version of the operation used for the response. For more information, see [Versioning for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx).

Date.description: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

put.description: The **Set Table Service Properties** operation sets properties for a storage account’s Table service endpoint, including properties for [Storage Analytics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh343270.aspx) and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules. See [Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535601.aspx) for more information on CORS rules.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see [Setting Timeouts for Queue Service Operations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179396.aspx).

Logging.description: Optional beginning with version 2013-08-15. Required for earlier versions. Groups the Azure Analytics Logging settings.

Version.description: The version of Storage Analytics to configure

Delete.description: Applies only to logging configuration. Indicates whether all delete requests should be logged.

Read.description: Applies only to logging configuration. Indicates whether all read requests should be logged.

Write.description: Applies only to logging configuration. Indicates whether all write requests should be logged.

Enabled.description: Indicates whether a retention policy is enabled for the storage service.

Days.description: Required only if a retention policy is enabled. Indicates the number of days that metrics or logging data should be retained. All data older than this value will be deleted. The minimum value you can specify is 1; the largest value is 365 (one year).

Metrics.description: Required for version 2012-02-12 and earlier; not applicable for version 2013-08-15 or later. Groups the Azure Analytics Metrics settings. The Metrics settings provide a summary of request statistics grouped by API in hourly aggregates for tables.

HourMetrics.description: Optional for version 2013-08-15 or later; not applicable for earlier versions. Groups the Azure Analytics **HourMetrics** settings. The **HourMetrics** settings provide a summary of request statistics grouped by API in hourly aggregates for blobs.

Version.description: The version of Storage Analytics to configure.

Enabled.description:
Indicates whether hour metrics are enabled for the Blob service.

If read-access geo-redundant replication is enabled, both primary and secondary metrics are collected. If read-access geo-redundant replication is not enabled, only primary metrics are collected.

IncludeAPIs.description: Required only if hour metrics are enabled. Indicates whether metrics should generate summary statistics for called API operations.

Enabled.description: Indicates whether a retention policy is enabled for the storage service.

Days.description: Required only if a retention policy is enabled. Indicates the number of days that metrics or logging data should be retained. All data older than this value will be deleted. The minimum value you can specify is 1; the largest value is 365 (one year).

MinuteMetrics.description: Optional for version 2013-08-15 or later; not applicable for earlier versions. Groups the Azure Analytics **MinuteMetrics** settings. The **MinuteMetrics** settings provide request statistics for each minute for blobs. For versions earlier than 2013-08-15, **MinuteMetrics** is not included in the response body.

Version.description: The version of Storage Analytics to configure.

Enabled.description:
Indicates whether minute metrics are enabled for the Blob service.

If read-access geo-redundant replication is enabled, both primary and secondary metrics are collected. If read-access geo-redundant replication is not enabled, only primary metrics are collected.

IncludeAPIs.description: Required only if minute metrics are enabled. Indicates whether metrics should generate summary statistics for called API operations.

Enabled.description: Indicates whether a retention policy is enabled for the storage service.

Days.description: Required only if a retention policy is enabled. Indicates the number of days that metrics or logging data should be retained. All data older than this value will be deleted. The minimum value you can specify is 1; the largest value is 365 (one year).

Cors.description:
The **Cors** element is supported for version 2013-08-15 or later. Groups all CORS rules.

Omitting this element group will not overwrite existing CORS settings.

CorsRule.description: Specifies a CORS rule for the Blob service. You can include up to five **CorsRule** elements in the request. If no **CorsRule** elements are included in the request body, all CORS rules will be deleted, and CORS will be disabled for the Blob service.

AllowedOrigins.description: A comma-separated list of origin domains that will be allowed via CORS, or "*" to allow all domains. Limited to 64 origin domains. Each allowed origin can have up to 256 characters.

ExposedHeaders.description: A comma-separated list of response headers to expose to CORS clients. Limited to 64 defined headers and two prefixed headers. Each header can be up to 256 characters.

MaxAgeInSeconds.description: The number of seconds that the client/browser should cache a preflight response.

AllowedHeaders.description: A comma-separated list of headers allowed to be part of the cross-origin request. Limited to 64 defined headers and 2 prefixed headers. Each header can be up to 256 characters.

AllowedMethods.description: A comma-separated list of HTTP methods that are allowed to be executed by the origin. For Azure Storage, permitted methods are DELETE, GET, HEAD, MERGE, POST, OPTIONS or PUT.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description:
Required. Specifies the content type of the payload. Possible values are:
* *application/atom+xml* (versions prior to 2015-12-11 only)
* *application/json*
For more information, see [Payload Format for Table Service Operations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535600.aspx).

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description:
Specifies the accepted content type of the response payload. Possible values are:
* *application/atom+xml* (versions prior to 2015-12-11 only)
* *application/json;odata=nometadata*
* *application/json;odata=minimalmetadata*
* *application/json;odata=fullmetadata*
For more information, see [Payload Format for Table Service Operations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535600.aspx).

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description:
Specifies whether the response should include the inserted entity in the payload. Possible values are *return-no-content* and *return-content*.
For more information about this header, see [Setting the Prefer Header to Manage Response Echo on Insert Operations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535596.aspx).

parameters.description: The length of the request body.

Preference-Applied.description:
Indicates whether the Prefer request header was honored. If the response does not include this header, then the Prefer header was not honored. If this header is returned, its value will either be *return-content* or *return-no-content*.
For more information, see [Setting the Prefer Header to Manage Response Echo on Insert Operations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535596.aspx).

options.description:
The **Preflight Table Request** operation queries the Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) rules for the Table service prior to sending the actual request. A web browser or another user agent sends a preflight request that includes the origin domain, method, and headers for the actual request that the agent wishes to make. If CORS is enabled for the Table service, then the Table service evaluates the preflight request against the CORS rules that the account owner has configured via [Set Table Service Properties](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh452240.aspx), and accepts or rejects the request.

For more information about CORS and the preflight request, see [the CORS specification](http://www.w3.org/TR/cors/) and [Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535601.aspx)

parameters.name: Origin
parameters.description: Specifies the origin from which the actual request will be issued. The origin is checked against the service's CORS rules to determine the success or failure of the preflight request.

parameters.name: Access-Control-Request-Method
parameters.description: Specifies the method (or HTTP verb) for the actual request. The method is checked against the service's CORS rules to determine the failure or success of the preflight request.

parameters.name: Access-Control-Request-Headers
parameters.description: Specifies the headers for the actual request headers that will be sent, then the service assumes no headers are sent with the actual request.

Access-Control-Allow-Origin.description: The allowed origin, which matches the origin header in the request if the preflight request succeeded.

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.description: If the preflight requests succeeds, this header is set to the value or values specified for the request header Access-Control-Request-Method.

Access-Control-Allow-Headers.description: If the preflight request succeeds, this header is set to the value or values specified for the request header Access-Control-Request-Headers.

Access-Control-Max-Age.description: Specifies the length of time the user agent is allowed to cache the preflight request for future requests.

Access-Control-Allow-Credentials.description: Indicates whether the actual request can be made using credentials. This header is always set to true.

parameters.description: Table to be deleted

parameters.name: x-ms-version
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request. For more information, see [Versioning for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx).

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
The client may specify the ETag for the entity on the request in order to compare to the ETag maintained by the service for the purpose of optimistic concurrency. The update operation will be performed only if the ETag sent by the client matches the value maintained by the server, indicating that the entity has not been modified since it was retrieved by the client.
To force an unconditional update, set If-Match to the wildcard character (*).

parameters.name: x-client-requiest-id
parameters.description: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled. Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server. For more information, see [About Storage Analytics Logging](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh343262.aspx) and [Azure Logging Using Logs to Track Storage Requests](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx).

Date.description: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

put.description:
Depending on what value you provide for **If-Match** header, following operation is triggered:
  * **If-Match not provided**: replaces an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.
  * **If-Match provided**: updates an existing entity in a table. The Update Entity operation replaces the entire entity and can be used to remove properties.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Insert Or Replace Entity operation sends the entity to be inserted as an OData entity set, which may be either an Atom or JSON payload. For more information, see [Inserting and Updating Entities](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894033.aspx).

parameters.description: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature. For more information, see [Authentication for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179428.aspx).

Required for Update Entity Operation. The client may specify the ETag for the entity on the request in order to compare to the ETag maintained by the service for the purpose of optimistic concurrency. The update operation will be performed only if the ETag sent by the client matches the value maintained by the server, indicating that the entity has not been modified since it was retrieved by the client.
To force an unconditional update, set If-Match to the wildcard character (*).

patch.description:
Depending on what value you provide for **If-Match** header, following operation is triggered:
  * **If-Match not provided**: replaces an existing entity or inserts a new entity if it does not exist in the table.
  * **If-Match provided**: merges an existing entity in a table.

get.description: The **Query Entities** operation queries entities in a table and includes the **$filter** and **$select** options.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: comma separated property names

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: query expression

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature. For more information, see [Authentication for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179428.aspx).

parameters.name: x-ms-version
parameters.description: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request. For more information, see [Versioning for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx).

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description:
Specifies the accepted content type of the response payload. Possible values are:
* *application/atom+xml* (versions prior to 2015-12-11 only)
* *application/json;odata=nometadata*
* *application/json;odata=minimalmetadata*
* *application/json;odata=fullmetadata*
For more information, see [Payload Format for Table Service Operations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535600.aspx).

parameters.name: x-client-requiest-id
parameters.description: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled. Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server. For more information, see [About Storage Analytics Logging](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh343262.aspx) and [Azure Logging Using Logs to Track Storage Requests](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx).

x-ms-continuation-NextPartitionKey.description:
The service returns the x-ms-continuation-NextPartitionKey and x-ms-continuation-NextRowKey continuation headers in the following cases:
* When the number of entities to be returned exceeds 1,000.
* When the server timeout interval is exceeded.
* When a server boundary is reached, if the query returns data that is spread across multiple servers.
For more information about using the continuation tokens, see [Query Timeout and Pagination](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd135718.aspx).

x-ms-continuation-NextRowKey.description:
he service returns the x-ms-continuation-NextPartitionKey and x-ms-continuation-NextRowKey continuation headers in the following cases:
* When the number of entities to be returned exceeds 1,000.
* When the server timeout interval is exceeded.
* When a server boundary is reached, if the query returns data that is spread across multiple servers.
For more information about using the continuation tokens, see [Query Timeout and Pagination](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd135718.aspx).

x-ms-request-id.description: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the service.

x-ms-version.description: Specifies the version of the operation used for the response. For more information, see [Versioning for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx).

Date.description: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

Content-Type.description:
Indicates the content type of the payload. Value depends on the request Accept header. Possible values are:
* *application/atom+xml* (versions prior to 2015-12-11 only)
* *application/json;odata=nometadata*
* *application/json;odata=minimalmetadata*
* *application/json;odata=fullmetadata*
For more information, see [Payload Format for Table Service Operations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535600.aspx).

* When the server timeout interval is exceeded.
* When a server boundary is reached, if the query returns data that is spread across multiple servers.
For more information about using the continuation tokens, see [Query Timeout and Pagination](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd135718.aspx).

x-ms-request-id.description: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the service.

x-ms-version.description: Specifies the version of the operation used for the response. For more information, see [Versioning for the Azure Storage Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx).

Date.description: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

Content-Type.description:
Indicates the content type of the payload. Value depends on the request Accept header. Possible values are:
* *application/atom+xml* (versions prior to 2015-12-11 only)
* *application/json;odata=nometadata*
* *application/json;odata=minimalmetadata*
* *application/json;odata=fullmetadata*
For more information, see [Payload Format for Table Service Operations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535600.aspx).
